Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
class stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >

This abstract class defines the basic interface used by all metric access methods implemented by this library.

Developers must use this class as the base class for all MAM implementations. Memory MAM must extend this class directly but disk MAM must extend stMetricTree instead.

Author
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino.nosp@m.@icm.nosp@m.c.usp.nosp@m..br)
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvie.nosp@m.ira@.nosp@m.icmc..nosp@m.usp..nosp@m.br)
Version
1.0
Since
Release 2
See also
stMetricTree

Definition at line 120 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
enum stMetricAccessMethod::stCommonQueryHintType

This enumeration defines the common query hint types that all metric trees must implement.

Warning
These values are always between 0 and 1023. Values outside this range are used by other metric trees to define their private set of query hint types.
Todo:
The set of query hint types must be defined.
Enumerator
QHT_NONE 

This query hint type forces CreateQueryHint() to return NULL. This type will be removed in future versions.

Disposes this instance and release all associated resources. The page manager will never be disposed by this destructor.

Definition at line 126 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::stMetricAccessMethod ( EvaluatorType *  eval)
inlineprotected

Creates a new metric access method.

The eval is the metric evaluator used by this class. This class will not claim the ownership of the given evaluator instance. In other words, it WILL NEVER BE DISPOSED by this class.

Parameters
evalThe metric evaluator used by this MAM.

inlinevirtual

This method adds an object to the metric tree.

The object pointed by obj will not be destroyed by this method.

Parameters
objThe object to be added.
Returns
True for success or false otherwise.
Exceptions
unsupported_method_errorIf this method is not supported by this tree.

Definition at line 138 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
virtual stQueryHint* stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::CreateQueryHint ( int  type)
inlinevirtual

Creates the proper query hint for a given operation type. A query hint instance may be required to perform certain types of operations.

The returned instance must be disposed by the application when it is no longer necessary.

Parameters
typeThe operation type.
Returns
An instance of the proper query hint of a given type for NULL for fail.
See also
stCommonQueryHintType
Warning
Each metric tree has its own implementation for each query hint type. DO NOT USE a hint created by a tree as a parameter for

Definition at line 302 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

References stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::myMetricEvaluator.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
virtual tResult* stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::KAndRangeQuery ( tObject *  sample,
stDistance  range,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false 
)
inlinevirtual

This method will perform a range query with a limited number of results.

This query is a combination of the standard range query and the standard k-nearest neighbour query. All objects which matches both conditions will be included in the result.

The object pointed by sample will not be destroyed by this method.

Parameters
sampleThe sample object.
rangeThe range of the results.
kThe maximum number of results.
tieThe tie list. Default false.
Returns
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

Reimplemented in stSlimTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, and stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.

Definition at line 213 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
virtual tResult* stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::KOrRangeQuery ( tObject *  sample,
stDistance  range,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false 
)
inlinevirtual

This method will perform range query with a limited number of results.

This query is a combination of the standard range query and the standard k-nearest neighbor query. All objects which matches with one of two conditions will be included in the result.

Parameters
sampleThe sample object.
rangeThe range of the results.
kThe maximum number of results.
tieThe tie list. This parameter is optional. Default false;
Returns
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

Reimplemented in stSlimTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, and stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.

Definition at line 232 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
virtual tResult* stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::KRingQuery ( tObject *  sample,
stDistance  inRange,
stDistance  outRange,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false 
)
inlinevirtual

This method will perform a ring query. The result will be a set of pairs object/distance.

The object pointed by sample will not be destroyed by this method.

Parameters
sampleThe sample object.
inRangeThe inner range of the results.
outRangeThe outter range of the results.
kThe number of nearest neighbor.
tieThe tie list. This parameter is optional. Default false;
Returns
The result.
Warning
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.
The inRange must be less than the outRange.
Exceptions
unsupported_method_errorIf this method is not supported by this tree.

Reimplemented in stSlimTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.

Definition at line 274 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
virtual tResult* stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::NearestQuery ( tObject *  sample,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false 
)
inlinevirtual

This method will perform a k nearest neighbour query. It is a new version that do a range query with a dynamic radius.

The object pointed by sample will not be destroyed by this method.

Parameters
sampleThe sample object.
kThe number of neighbours.
tieThe tie list. Default false.
Returns
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

Reimplemented in stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, stDFTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, stSlimTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, stMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, stVPTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, stGHTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, and stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.

inlinevirtual

Optimizes the structure of this tree. If the structure doesn't support this operation, this method will do nothing.

Reimplemented in stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, and stSlimTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.

Definition at line 294 of file stMetricAccessMethod.h.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
virtual tResult* stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::PointQuery ( tObject *  sample)
inlinevirtual

This method will return the object in the tree that has the distance 0 to the query object. In other words, the query object itself.

If there are more elements that has distance 0 to the query object, this method will return the first found.

The object pointed by sample will not be destroyed by this method.

Parameters
sampleThe sample object.
Returns
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning
This method return only one object that has distance 0 to the query object.
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

Reimplemented in stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, stSlimTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, stDFTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >, and stMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.
